ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Information on pilgrimage studies and pilgrimage practices. History of Catholicism in China
learned more about religious pilgrimage in china and tibet, some theoretical frameworks of pilgrimage, and tourism as well

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Diverse body of readings. Weaknesses: Bi-weekly meetings. Lack of in-seminar engagement on part of many students. Lack of feedback concerning running grade in seminar.
great course, i think the co-teaching method worked well

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Depending on their interests, yes. The readings and theoretical materials were interesting, though, outside of interest in religious studies or pilgrimage studies, students may get less out of seminar.
yes, would definitely recommend. a unique course taught by great professors, though I don't think it'll be offered again
